detail: This is part of the course Software Engineering, Academic Year 2023. The objective is to present the analysis and design of the software system for a café. The system includes management of in-store orders, cashier operations, advance orders, online payments, product reviews and promotions, revenue and expense calculations, employee and membership management, and inventory control. This aims to understand, develop, and improve the software efficiently.
working: Web application that handles orders, pre-orders, and gradients at a café using React, Go and Andesign.
Implemented Agile methodology with weekly Scrum meetings and GitHub Project Management.
Unit testing and automated testing using Katalon.

detail: This is part of the course System Analysis and Design, Developed a Welfare System and Temple Administration project consolidates various temples across Thailand, enabling Buddhist communities to conveniently access temple services online. It also benefits temples by managing diverse operations such as borrowing facilities, notifying event hosts, and accepting temple donations.
working: Analyzed user requirements and Design UMLs diagrams.
Designed a user-friendly UI Utilized  Figma.

detail: Developed a web application using Go for calculating GPA, GPAX, and grade points specifically designed for first-year engineering students at Suranaree University of Technology.
features: Study Plan Selection: Users can select from various study plans (A, B, C, D, E, F, X1, X2) based on the academic year 2023 curriculum.
Grade Point Comparison: The application allows students to compare their expected grade points with historical statistics from 2019-2022.
Non-Commercial: This project is entirely non-profit and all data has been gathered and verified by the developer.
data_sources: All information was meticulously researched and compiled by the developer. Apologies for any potential inaccuracies.
working: Study Plan Selection: Users can select from various study plans (A, B, C, D, E, F, X1, X2) based on the academic year 2023 curriculum.

detail: As part of the "Database Systems" course, the student dormitory system aims to analyze and design a database system for managing student dormitories. It facilitates various functionalities for students, including registration, room selection, dormitory and room management, advisor assignment, service room registration, maintenance requests, document appointment scheduling, and payment processing.
working: Conducted database design analysis, created ER Diagrams, implemented Triggers, and developed UI for efficient data management. Integrated Mview for data visualization using C# .NET and MySQL.
